source_file: North Western Karnataka Road Transport Corporation.txt
text:
Accident relief fund
Eligibility: Legal Heirs of the deceased
Supporting Document:
1. Death Certificate
2. Postmortem Report
3. Affidavit
4. Police FIR
5. Identity Card
6. “G”-Tree (Generation Tree/Family
7. Passport size photo of legal heirs
8. Legal heirs Bank passbook copy
9. Aadhar
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : 30
Delivery Time (Days) : 30
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant logs into Seva Sindhu portal.
2. Applicant provides the user credentials provided by Drugs Control Department to apply for this service
3. Applicant submits the application on Seva Sindhu portal along with necessary supporting documents and makes the payment for the service.
4. Applicant to provide clarification through re-submission of documents if requested by the Department
5. The approving authority approves and applicant collects the digitally signed certificate or the approving authority rejects and applicant collects the endorsement stating reasons for rejection.

service_name: Application for appointment on compassionate grounds - Group C posts
text:
Application for appointment on compassionate grounds - Group C posts
Eligibility: a) Minimum Age is 18 years and above
b) For General Category Applicant: Maximum age limit is 35 years
c) For OBC (Category - 2A/2B/3A/3B): Maximum age limit is 38 years
d) For SCs/STs /OBC (Category – I): Maximum age limit is 40 years
e) For Widow – 10 years age relaxation above the max. age limit under each category
Supporting Document:
1) Scanned Copy of Original Death Certificate of deceased employee
2) Departmental Identity Card of the deceased employee
3) Ration Card of the family of the deceased employee
4) Scanned Copy of Original Survival Certificate of family members of deceased employee issued by Revenue Authorities
5) Certified copy of PAN card of the applicant
6) Certified copy of Aadhaar card of the applicant
7) Certified copy of Electoral Card of the applicant
8) Scanned Copy of Original Certificate of Educational Qualification of the applicant
9) Scanned Copy of Original Transfer Certificate of the applicant issued by the School or Educational Institution last studied
10) Scanned Copy of Caste Certificate of the applicant
11) Notarized Affidavit No Objection Certificate stating other members in the family of deceased employee agreed to give appointment to the applicant
12) Notarized Affidavit swearing that none of the members in the deceased’s family has got appointment on compassionate ground
13) Scanned Copy of Original Annual Income Certificate of the family in the prescribed format as per Government notification no. DPAR 10 SCA 95 dated: 12-09-1996. Only for appointment on compassionate ground
Application Fee : Rs 0
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs 40
Delivery Time (Days) : 90
Procedure for applying:
1. Application submission (online, B1/K1 centers, CSC centers, AJSK centers, Bapuji Seva Kendras)
2. The application is routed to Principal Secretary
3. The application is forwarded to Special Secretary
4. The application is forwarded to Deputy Secretary
5. The application is forwarded to Under Secretary
6. The application is forwarded to Section Officer
7. The application is forwarded to Case Worker
8. Application and document verification by case worker. The report is submitted to Section Officer
9. The report is verified and submitted to Under Secretary
10. The application is forwarded for Police verification and caste verification (in case of OBC/SC/ST)
11. The verification report is forwarded to Section Officer
12. The verification report is forwarded to Case worker
13. Case report prepared by Case worker and submitted to Section Officer
14. Case report verified by Section Officer and submitted to Under Secretary
15. Case report verified by Under Secretary and submitted to Deputy Secretary
16. Case report verified by Deputy Secretary and submitted to Special Secretary
17. Case report verified by Special Secretary and submitted to Principal Secretary
18. Based on the application, submitted documents, verification and case report, the Principal Secretary can approve or reject the application
19. Issue the e-signed appointment letter/endorsement

service_name: Application for Internship Program in Government of Karnataka
text:
Application for Internship Program in Government of Karnataka
Eligibility: The applicant should be a Post graduate/ Research Scholar from any recognized University/ Academic/ Research Institution within India or abroad.

Supporting Document:
1. Curriculum Vitae
2. Letter from Institution / University for No-Objection
3. Statement of Purpose (SoP)
4. Letter of Reference (optional)
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs. 25
Delivery Time (Days) : NA
Procedure for applying:
a) Application submission in on Seva Sindhu Portal (Online, Seva Sindhu Centres)
b) Application is routed to the Case worker of the Karnataka Evaluation Authority (KEA), case worker to verify and forward to Administrative Officer
c) Administrative Officer to review and recommend the application to CEO for approval
d) CEO to approve/ reject the application
e) Applicant to be initmated on the status of application
f) Payment receipt generation in Seva Sindhu

If the Birth happened at hospital please download the certificate from here:http://serviceonline.gov.in/karnataka/directApply.do?serviceId=1456

service_name: Approving the Seniority List of Housing Societies
text:
Approving the Seniority List of Housing Societies
Eligibility: Co-operatives
Supporting Document:
1. Particular regarding incorporating the provision of 30""B"" directions in the byelaws of the society.
2. Resolution of the board regarding fixation of price per square feet and approval of the g.b.m
3. Particular regarding notice issued by the society to the members communicating the price fixed for site(dimension wise) and the last date for remitting the sital deposit.
4. Reservation of sites to sc/st members as per 30b directions. If sc/st members are not available distributing the said sites to the eligible general members as per seniority with prior approval from the RCS
5.The seniority list should have round seal of the society on each page with due attestation by the president and secretary of the society on the left side of the page.
6. Documents relating to the layout developed by the society i.e. i) Land acquisition by the competent authority with revenue survey numbers. ii) Plan approved by the competent authority and work order.
7. Particulars regarding whether the layout developed by the society is in accordance with the provisions of the jurisdictions mentioned in the bye law and the number of layouts
8. Particulars regarding Seniority list of Geninue members and sital depositers who have paid maximum sital deposits in decending order as per cut off date given by the society.
9. The particulars regarding members who paid sital deposit information to be provided by the Society in requist form
10.The seniority list
11. Particulars regarding land disputes if any is pending.
12. Relinquish deed of the society handing over the civic amenities land to the competent authority.
13. Caste Certificate of Members belonging to SC/ST category
14. Notarised affidavit for not holding any site
15. certificate regarding employment & service details
16. Domicile certificate for residing 10 years in Karnatka
Application Fee : Nill
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs. 35
Delivery Time (Days) : 60
Procedure for applying:
1 . ANNUAL GENERAL BODY MEETING NOTICE AND ACKNOWLEDGMENT FOR SERVING THE NOTICE
2 . ANNUAL GENERAL BODY MEETING PROCEEDINGS COPY.
3 . ATTENDANCE OF THE MEMBERS WHO ARE PRESENT IN ANNUAL GENERAL BODY MEETING.
4 . ANNEXURE I TO 6 WITH SIGNATURE OF WHO PRESIDE OVER THE ANNUAL GENERAL MEETING AND SEAL AND SIGNATURE OF THE CEO AND BOARD OF DIRECTORS
5 . COPY OF THE EXISTING BYLAW.
6 . SIX COPIES OF PROPOSED AMENDMENT
7 . AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
8 . DOCUMENTS AS PRESCRIBED UNDER SECTION 11 OF THE KSS ACT, 1997.

service_name: APPLICATION FOR PERMISSION TO DRAW WATER FOR INDUSTRIAL USE
text:
APPLICATION FOR PERMISSION TO DRAW WATER FOR INDUSTRIAL USE
Eligibility: As per the conditions mentioned I the Government Circular No: WRD 78 KBN 2025 Dated:14.02.2025 Guidelines to be followed by Industrialist/Companies for proposals of allocation of Water permission to Industries-Reg.
Supporting Document:
Base Documents:
1)Detailed Project Report with Index Map.
2) Water lifting point marked on toposheets of scale 1:50,000 with latitude and Longitude
Water Storage Documents:
1)Layout Plan of the project site with storage site marked
2)Cross Sectional details of the Proposed storage with plan
3)Elevation drawing of the Storage details
4)Intake well design and drawing details with suitable scale
5)Pipeline details from intake well up to water storage facility
6)Pumping mechanism details
Statutory Approved Documents:
1)GO issued by the Commerce and Industries Department *(Mandatory) To upload the latest Government order
2) NOC/Permission of MOEF
3) Permission from KSPCB
4)Affidavit to be collected on behalf of the Authorised Person
Application Fee : Rs.50000+18% GST=Rs.59000
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.45/- (Seva Sindhu processing charge)
Delivery Time (Days) : 120 days
Procedure for applying:
1.The service involves allocating water to industries for which permission has been accorded based on Government orders issued by the Department of Commerce and Industry to the respective Industries.
2.This allocation is subject to the opinion of the concerned MD Nigam/Chief Engineer, WRD, regarding the availability of water, CE ISW regarding allocation of water as requested by Industries at the lifting point of the proposal.
3.This includes a detailed study on backwater eects, as well as the impact on upstream downstream commitments, yield and water allocation to the State by Tribunals.
4.For renewal purposes, industries submit applications to the government, which will be scrutinized by the concerned MDs of Nigam, CE WRD and CE ISW.
5.The scrutiny is based on the quantity of water used, water rates collected, condition mentioned in the GO issued by the Government to the company for water permission, satisfactory ful?lment of all conditions by the industry as per the Govt circular : WRD 78 KBN 2025 Dated:14.02.2025.

service_name: Application for Caste Verification Report - SC/ST
text:
Application for Caste Verification Report - SC/ST
Eligibility: Shortlisted canidadates from respective recuruting organisation
Supporting Document:
1. Primary school admission extract (1st Standard only).
2. Caste Certificate issued by tahsildar.
3. Passport Photo.
4. Caste certificate of father issued by Tahsildar from Permanent Address location (if Father's caste certificate not available then then father’s brother/ sister’s caste certificate).
5. Father’s School admission extract (if Father is illiterate then Father’s Brother/ sister’s school admission extract).
6. Family tree.
7. Ration Card.
8. Photocopy of Aadhaar.
9. Family tree issued by Tahsildar
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs 35
Delivery Time (Days) : 15
Procedure for applying:
1. Respective recruting department to intimate the DC committee/District SW office and the candidate for the Sindhutva Pramana Patra.
2. Applicant to fill the form in the Seva Sindhu Portal.
3. District officer to verify the details/ documents and initiate field inspection by Taluk officer.
4. Taluk officer to conduct field inspection and submit report.
5. District officer to review the report, and set up meeting with DC committee.
6. DC committee to decide to issue Sindhutva Pramana Patra or not.

Arivu Educational Renewal Loan Scheme
Eligibility: Have you passed you Previous Years Examination
Supporting Document:
1. Fee Receipt
2. Study Certificate
3. Upload Claim Letter including Sanction Order
4. Previous Year Marksheet
5. Parent Approval Letter
6. Collateral Letter
Application Fee : Rs.0
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.30
Delivery Time (Days) : Non Sakala
Procedure for applying:
Step 1: Applicant submits the application.
Step 2: The application reaches the Case Worker (L1 Officer) at District Level.
The Case worker verifies the application and sends it to the next level.
Step 3: The Application from the case worker reaches the Program Officer (L2 Officer) for the next level of verification. Program Officer is also at District Level.
Step 4: From the Program officer login the Application reaches the Disbursement Officer Login (L3 Officer). The disbursement officer is at the state level
. Step 5: The Application is pushed from the disbursement officer login to DBT.

text:
Caste and Annual Income Certificate obtained from the concerned Taluk Tahsildar/Revenue Officers in the prescribed format regarding belonging to the community
2. Aadhaar Card/Ration Card/Electoral Identity Card for proof of residence of the applicant.
3. Applicant passport size 02 recent photos.
4. Self Help Group Conduct Book and Account Number held in the name of Self Help Group in bank and IFSC regarding formation of Self Help Group. Xerox or canceled copy of pass book for number information.
5. All members of Self Help Group must write a cover letter stating that they are committed to the loan security.
6. Declaration of assets and liabilities of applicant and guarantor.
7. Xerox copy of applicant Aadhaar Card
8. Confirmation that the self-help Group has not received approval from other government departments and banks.

Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.30
Delivery Time (Days) : Non Sakala
Procedure for applying:
Step 1: Applicant will log in to his account.
Step2: Search his scheme on the search bar.
Step3: Applicant has to confirm his details like Religion, Caste Category, Gender, Domicile, Age, Farmer, caste belongs to caste listed under the corporation.
Step4: Applicant should fall under the caste list provided by Corporation.

service_name: Talking Laptop to Students with Visual Impairment students studying in SSLC
source_file: Suvidha Schemes - Department for Empowerment of Differently Abled and Senior Citizen.txt
text:
Talking Laptop to Students with Visual Impairment students studying in SSLC
Eligibility: 1. UDID Card and certificate is mandatory
2.A Laptop provided by Govt does not transfer to another person for any reason.
3. The candidate is eligible to get this facility once in a lifetime.
4. Self-declared Confirmation should be given, that the applicant has not received any Laptop from other departments or organizations. Unter this Scheme, the Selection process of eligible candidates will be made through a committee formed under the chairmanship of the Deputy Director of the Women and Child Development Department at the district level.
Supporting Document:
1. UDID card certificate
2. Caste Certificate Issued by Tahsildar
3. SSLC and current academic year mark sheet (If the student is currently studying in 10th grade, then they should upload the 9th grade Passed Marks List.)
4. Residence proof obtained from Tahsildad regarding residence in Karnataka for 10 years
5. Self declaratiion letter that the laptop is not obtained is not obtained fro any other social welfare Department/other Department/University
6. Recommendation letter from the school / College (upload)
7. Residential certificate
8. No laptop transfer self declaration on 100rs Bond. (upload)
9. Study certificate
10.passsport size photo
Application Fee : 0
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.35
Delivery Time (Days) : Non Sakala
Procedure for applying:

service_name: Motorized Two Wheeler for Persons with Physically Disability
source_file: Suvidha Schemes - Department for Empowerment of Differently Abled and Senior Citizen.txt
text:
Motorized Two Wheeler for Persons with Physically Disability
Eligibility: 1. Persons with disabilities are citizens of India and must have resided in Karnataka for at least 10 years.
2. The facility is provided only 01 times in a lifetime to severely physically challenged persons in the age-group of 20 to 60 years.
3. The annual income of the family should be less than Rs. 2 lakhs to get the benefit of this scheme.
4. UDID Card and Medical Certificate are mandatory. The PwDs, who have already received a motorized two-wheeler from another department or organization, are not eligible.
Supporting Document:
1. Income certificate less then 2 lakh per annum.
2. UDID
3. LL/DL certificate.
4. work Certifiacte / Study certificate
5. Motorized two-wheeler not obtained from any other department or sources in Rs.20/- Bond
6. passsport size photo (upload)
Application Fee : 0
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.30
Delivery Time (Days) : Non Sakala
Procedure for applying:

source_file: Suvidha Schemes - Department for Empowerment of Differently Abled and Senior Citizen.txt
text:
Braille Kit for Person with Visual Impairment
Eligibility: 1. Disability Certificate & UDID Card Mandatory.
2. Blind students should be citizens of India and residents of Karnataka for at least 10 years.
3. Should be pursuing at least SSLC and higher education. Proof of education from the head of the college should be provided.
4. There is no income limit for availing of the scheme, residence proof is mandatory.
5. Blind students availing the benefit of this scheme should not have received similar benefits from any other source.
6. Blind students having 10% or more Disability.
7. The facility sanctioning authority will be the District Level Meeting, presided over by the Deputy Director, Women and Child Development Department.
Supporting Document:
1. Study Certificate / Voter ID
2. UDID
3. Recommendation letter from the school / College
4. Residential certificate
5. passsport size photo
Application Fee : 0
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.35
Delivery Time (Days) : Non Sakala
Procedure for applying:

service_name: Sewing Machines for Self Employed Persons with Hearing Impairement
source_file: Suvidha Schemes - Department for Empowerment of Differently Abled and Senior Citizen.txt
text:
Sewing Machines for Self Employed Persons with Hearing Impairement
Eligibility: 1. The hearing-impaired person should be a citizen of India and a resident of Karnataka for at least the last 10 years.
2. Should have studied up to SSLC and should submit a certificate related to the profession.
3. There is no income limit for hearing-impaired persons to avail of the scheme.
4. Beneficiaries with hearing impairment, getting benefits under this scheme, should not have received similar benefits from any other source and should provide a certificate to this effect, attested by a notary.
5. Proportion of disabled persons with hearing impairment should be 40% or more.
6. It is compulsory for the hearing-impaired person to provide proof of residence obtained by the concerned person.
7. Under this scheme will facility be provided only once in a lifetime. After receiving the facility, it should not be transferred/assigned to anyone else.
Supporting Document:
1.Tailioring class certificate and literacy certifiacte
2.UDID Card
3.Residence proof obtained from Tahsildad regarding residence in Karnataka for 10 years
4.Regarding non transfer/resale of sewing machine self declaration
5.Certificate for not being in Government or Private employment
6.Self declaratiion letter not obtained Sewing Machines from any other department or social welfare Department/University
7.self declaration Certificate of not sealing Sewing Machines attested by a Rs.20 stamps paper.
8.Not availed same benefit in other department with notary
9.passsport size photo
Application Fee : 0
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.35
Delivery Time (Days) : Non Sakala
Procedure for applying:

Eligibility: 1. Handicapped candidate should provide proof of residence in Karnataka State for 10 years from the Tehsildar or proof of education completed in Karnataka for 10 years.
2. Certificate obtained from the concerned Medical Board about having a disability (UDID) should be provided.
3. Should not have received subsidy/equipment in the past, either from the Government or from Association A.
Supporting Document:
1.Self declaratiion letter /document that aid and appliances has been taken in previous year from any department/gramma panchayat/taluk panchayat
2.Income certificate recently obtained from Tahsildar
3. Residence proof obtained from Tahsildad regarding residence in Karnataka for 10 years
4.No age limit
5.UDID Card
6. passsport size photo

3) Application form will be scrutinized then the applicant will be directed to pay the fees
c) After paying the fees the transaction will be initiated
d) Applicant has to attend oral/written test and the IMV will record the test result
e) If Applicant passes the test then transaction data entry will take place

g) LL will be printed in the Pre-Printed form and it will be authorized.
h) Delivery of LL to applicant

service_name: Department: Animal Husbandry and Veterinary Service
text:
Department: Animal Husbandry and Veterinary Service

1. Application for License to Manufacture and /or Trade Poultry and Livestock Feed
Eligibility: As per “Karnataka Poultry and Livestock Feed (regulation of Manufacture and sale) order 1987” Poultry and livestock feed manufacturers and or Trader/ dealers may apply for a license
Supporting Document:
1. Current License certificate of Manufacturer issued by the department of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services -
2. Current License certificate of Trader issued by the department of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services
3. Blueprint of manufacturing unit
4. Document relating to feed distributors or traders
5 Recent electricity bill
6. Approval for electricity connection from Electricity Department
7.Latest Feed analytical report of diffrent varity of feed manufacture.
8.Declaration by Manufacturer
9.Inspection report on Manufacturing Unit by Veterinary officer
10.Inspection report on trading Unit by Veterinary officer
11.Declaration by Trader
12.Declaration by Dealer
Application Fee : 1. Security Deposit for New Licesee Rs.1000/
2. License for Manufacturer fee on number of Hp- Rs.1000/- for first Hp and Rs.20/- for subsequent HP.
3. License for Trade/ Dealer fee Rs.500/-
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.100
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 working days
Procedure for applying:
1.Applicant Logs into Seva Sindhu portal.
2. Search for Livestock poultry under Animal Husbandry.
3. Fill the application
4. Upload relevant document (JPEG and PDF Format)
5. Submit

2.

Department: Ayush Department

1. Application for Issue of Non conviction certificate
Eligibility: The agency should have a valid ASU number
Supporting Document:
1) Cover letter
2) Affidavit from Magistrate (not below Grade I) on Rs. 50 Stamp paper
3) GMP certificate
4) Approved Product List

text:
Department: Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board

1. Permission for new connection/ additional connection for water supply and Under Ground Drainage for multi-storied buildings.
Eligibility: The Owner or Occupier of the building residing in BWSSB serviceable area and who desires to have water supply or sanitary connection to his premises are eligible to get this service.
Supporting Document:

service_name: Lease cum Sale deed or Sale Deed
source_file: Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board.txt
text:
Lease cum Sale deed or Sale Deed
Katha
  If previous receipts available, please attach

source_file: Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board.txt
text:
NOC (If applicable)
Application Fee : Rs.100
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.30
Delivery Time (Days) : 42 Days
Procedure for applying:
The application shall be filled in online along with photos of applicant, sanction plan Road cutting endorsement issued by BBMP/BDA, upto date tax paid receipt, occupancy certificate for multi storied buildings, khata certificate, photographs of building, owner, and rain water harvesting system, receipt of GBWASP payment to be uploaded. Then Assistant Engineer or Water Inspector will inspect and recommend the file. AEE will sanction the domestic house service connections at sub division office. In respect of multi storied buildings which attract prorata charges, the measurement of the building will be taken, recorded and recommended by AE and AEE then the file will be forwarded to office of Executive Engineer/Additional Chief Engineer/Chief Engineer/Engineer-In-Chief/Chairman to sanction the file depending on amount of prorata as per delegation of powers. Executive Engineer/Additional Chief Engineer/Chief Engineer/Engineer-In-Chief/Chairman will inspect the premises and take action to sanction the file.

2. Replacement of faulty Meters
Eligibility: Residents in Bengaluru having water and/or Sanitary Connection with RR number from BWSSB
Supporting Document:

source_file: Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board.txt
text:
Water Bill
Application Fee : Meter Cost will be raised as per the Dia of the water supply connection
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.20
Delivery Time (Days) : 8 Days
Procedure for applying:
The owner, occupier request for replacement of faulty meter through online or through written application at the sub division, duly providing the details of RR Nos. Meter Make, Meter No. and final reading of the meter.
AEE on preliminary verification of the request will forward the same to concerned Water Inspector of Service Station for Inspection and report.
Water Inspector inspects the premises of the building & observes the meter for two consecutive water supplies and submits the status of the meter.
If meter is found faulty and recommends for replacement fo meter.
Assistant Engineer after verification of the inspection report of Water Inspector, put up the file for replacement of faulty meter.
Assistant Executive Engineer verified the testing report and AEE will accord approval for replacement of faulty meters depending on the availability of meter in the stock. Draftsman will issue the new meter to Water Inspector for replacement of faulty meters and new meter will be fixed.

3. Transfer of Connection/Ownership (Industrial/ Commercial Connections/ Others Connections)
Eligibility: Residents in Bengaluru having water and/or Sanitary Connection with RR number from BWSSB
Supporting Document:
1)Sale Deed
2)Khatha Extract
3)Recent tax paid receipt
4)Water bill
5)Affidavit
Application Fee : Rs.250
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.25
Delivery Time (Days) : 10 working days
Procedure for applying:
The owner who desires to change the name in BWSSB water/ sanitary connections due to transfer in ownership of the property, have to submit the application through online duly providing the details of the communication Address, location address, Khatha Number, PID Number, BWSSB RRNumber and Name of the consumer to be changed against the BWSSB connection.
Sakala timeline starts from the time of submission of application online. GSC code will be generated and the application will be processed within 10 working days.
AEE verifies the reports submitted by AE/WI and Revenue Manager /Draughts Man and approves the application for change of name. •Demand note of Rs.250/- will be generated and Sakala timeline ends here.
Consumer has to pay the amount of Rs.250/- through Online. On receipt of payment against demand note ownership of the BWSSB connections will be changed.

4. Water Supply /Sewerage complaints
Eligibility: Any individual
Supporting Document:

service_name: No documents are required to be provided

Department: Commerce And Industries Department

1. Sanction of Investment Promotion subsidy for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
Eligibility: 1. Micro or small or medium enterprise investing in New/ Expansion/ Modernisation / Diversification of project
2. The unit shall avail more than 50% loan from commercial bank/ KSFC/ RRB/Co-op bank
Supporting Document:
1.Duly filled in Application in the prescribed format as in Annexure–4
2.Statement of Fixed Assets in prescribed format in Annexure–5
3.Original Investment certificate issued by the KSFC/KSIIDC/Bank/Other financial institutions in prescribed format as in Annexure–6
4. Original Certificate from Civil Engineer/Architect in prescribed format in respect of investment made inbuilding as in Annexure–7
5. Form of declaration regarding employment of local persons in the prescribed format as in Annexure– 8
6. Original investment certificate from Chartered Accountant in prescribed format as in Annexure–9 in respect of small and medium enterprises
7. A copy of the Project report duly signed by the Promoter
8. Copy of Land documents/records
9. Copy of term loan sanction orders from KSFC/KSIIDC/Bank/Other financial institutions recognized by RBI
10.Copy of First sale invoice
11. Copy of Udyam Registration Certificate
12. Copy of registered partnership deed/Memorandum and Articles of Association/byelaws
13. Copy of Caste certificates in respect of SC/ST minorities/Backward class (category 1 & 2A only) issued by competent authority and appropriate certificate/documents in respect of Physically Challenged/Ex-servicemen entrepreneurs
15. Copy of power sanction/power serviced, letter
16. VAT Registration Certificate from Commercial Tax Department if applicable
17. Certificate from the Textile Department for not availed subsidy in respect of Textile based industries including Readymade Garment/Certified from Department of Agriculture/ Horticulture for not availed subsidy in respect of Agro Food Processing Industry in any of the Government of Karnataka/India Schemes 18. Copy of approved building plan Or Copy of license obtained from competent authority
Application Fee : NIL
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : NIL
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 days
Procedure for applying:
The Joint Director, District Industries Centre after verification of the eligibility of the Micro, small and medium unit has to be placed before the DLC for sanctions and issue the sanction order in the prescribed format

2. Stamp Duty Exemption and Registration Fees Concession Certificate
Eligibility: (i) loan agreements, credit deeds, mortgage and hypothecation deeds executed for availing loans from KSFC, Commercial Banks, RRBs, Co-operative Banks, KVIB/KVIC
(ii) for lease deeds, lease-cum-sale and absolute sale deeds executed by industrial enterprises in respect of industrial plots, sheds, industrial tenements by KIADB, KSSIDC, KEONICS, Industrial Co-operatives and approved private industrial estates shall be exempted
Supporting Document:
1.Duly filled in prescribed application form as per Annexure-15
2. Attested copy of the project report duly signed by the promoter
3. Attested copy of partnership deed/Memorandum and Articles of Association/Bye-laws
4. Attested copy of Udyam Registration or 100% EOU certificate
5. Attested copy of the DLSWCC/SLSWCCC/SHLCC approval obtained by the unit/copy of government order, if issued
6. Attested copy of shed /land allotment order/possession certificate
7. Attested copy of unregistered lease deed/lease-cum-sale deed
8. Form of declaration regarding employment of local person in Annexure-8 in case of existing unit
9. Attested copy of approval order/permission obtained from revenue department under section 109 of KLR Act for purchase of land
10. Details of existing investment in case of Expansion/Modernisation/Diversification
Application Fee : NIL
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : NIL
Delivery Time (Days) : 10 days
Procedure for applying:
The concerned office after verification of eligibility of the enterprise has to issue the Stamp duty exemption & Concessional Registration Charges certificate to the enterprise in prescribed format

3. Electricity Duty Exemption Certificate
Eligibility: Micro or small or medium enterprise investing in New/ Expansion/ Modernisation / Diversification of project
Supporting Document:
1. Application on letterhead/plain paper
2. Copy of Udyam Registration
3. First Sale Invoice
4. Land documents
5. ESCOMs power sanction letter and service letter with R.R. No. and date
6. Copies of the 1st and latest electricity bills with receipt
7. Copy of Govt. Order approving the project in respect of focused manufacturing sector
Application Fee : NIL
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : NIL
Delivery Time (Days) : 50 days

After verifying the application of the enterprises and satisfying the genuineness of the facts, electricity duty exemption certificate in the prescribed format

Eligibility: The micro enterprise shall be obtained loan from Commercial ban, RRB, Co-op bank.
Supporting Document:

The Joint Director, District Industries Centre after verification of the eligibility of the Micro unit has to be placed before the DLC for sanctions and issue the sanction order in the prescribed format

Eligibility: Land for industrial purpose should be purchased by order of the Revenue Department under section 109 of the Karnataka Land Reforms Act.
Supporting Document:

receipt/challan as proof of payment made towards land conversion charges

9. a) Lift/Escalator/Passenger conveyor Inspection & recommendation by ACEI/DCEI
b) Grant of Lift/Escalator/Passenger conveyor running license by Chief Electrical Inspector to Govt.
Eligibility: Any person or Company who intends to get the Lift/Escalator/Passenger Conveyors erected in the State of Karnataka
Supporting Document:
Application from Owner in Form B-1and enclose the following,Completion report of the Registered person in respect of Lift in Form-B2 and in respect of escalator and passenger conveyor in Form-B3
Copy of manufacturer test certificates for the following, namely:-
In case of Lifts:-
a. motor or machine.
b. over speed governor .
c. controller.
d. buffers.
e. door drive.
f. lift Car and Landing door fire rating.
g. main hoist and governor rope.
f. electrical travelling cable.
In case of Escalators or Passenger conveyors:-
a. motor and machine.
b. over speed governor.
c. controller.
Enclose original recipt or challan of Rs 2500/- per lift and Rs.25/- application fee
Application Fee : Rs.25/-(Application Fee) + Rs.2500/-(per lift/escalator/passenger conveyor)
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.2500/-(per lift/escalator/passenger conveyor)
Delivery Time (Days) : 20 Days
Procedure for applying:
1 - Applicant will log in to service of oficial website www.ksei.gov.in
2 - Departmental webpage will open showing the details of service, details of scanned documents requires , service process.
3 - Next enter the mobile number and apllicant will get the OTP which is to be entered. Once OTP is entered the application get opened.
4 - Applicant need to fill all fields, upload all the requested scanned documents and make online payment of fees then save and submit
5-After successful submission of application , applicant will get the acknowledgement.
6 - The concerned AEI will receive the application online and verifies documents , test certificates , notes his/her observations and generates the report and submits the same online to Additional Chief Electrical Inspector/Deputy Chief Electrical Inspector for inspection
7 - ACEI/DCEI reviews the report and the application submitted . If application found in order , the ACEI/DCEI will update the inspection date.On the scheduled dates the authority will conduct the inspection.If observations are found during the inspection , defect leter will be issued to the applicant and if installation is in confirmity with Act abd Rules , ACEI/ DCEI will prepare recommendation letter to CEIG for issue of License.
8 - Applicant shall attend the defects and submit the compliance report for having attended the defects and submit the compliance report for having attended the defects intimated by this department through online.ACEI/DCEI will visit the spot and verify the defects . And will recommend to CEIg for issue of License.
9 - AEI at Head office will receive the recommendation letter from ACEI/ DCEI online. AEI will prepare the draft of the License and will sent to DEI for review.
10 - CEIG will issue the licencse

10. Approval of drawings of the electrical installation
Eligibility: Electrical Installation in the jurisdiction of the state of Karnataka(Electrical Installation belonging to Government of India and its undertakings are excluded).
Supporting Document:
1) Affidavit-8 and Form-Z
2) Power Sanction letter, Estimate and sketch
3) Electricals Drawings showing SLD, plan and elevation.
Note:- Prescribed drawing scrutiny fees shall be paid
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : https://ksei.gov.in/eisoft/Documents/fee-HT.pdf
Delivery Time (Days) : 25 days-Head Office & 20 days Field Office Days
Procedure for applying:
1. Citizen will log in to service of official website www.ksei.gov.in website. Citizens are requested to provide the correct email ID for further communication process.
2. Use the created User ID and password to login into the website.
3. After login, Click on Approval of Electrical Installation button then select the option Application for Drawing Approvals / installation approval as per the requirement.
4. While clicking on Application for Drawing Approvals / Installation approval, Applicants are requested to read the Annexure(s) carefully before entering to fill the details
5. Details of Fee payable for approval of drawings/ Installation approval will be displayed automatically based on the inputs of Installation.
6. The Applicant shall remit the requisite fee through Online Payment / Delivery Challan
7. Applicants shall upload all the required documents/ drawings by clicking browse and upload option.
8. Before final submission of the application, Applicant are requested to check the details if they have entered correctly. In case if they are not sure about the details they can save the application and then submit the application once confirmed
9. Confirmation message will be displayed after successful submission of application.
10. To view application status click on Application Status link available in the home page.
11. Approving authority will start the process at their end as per the uploaded drawings.
12. After verification of documents and drawings by the Approving authority, if it is in order approval will be issued. If any application is not in order any clarification/shortfall in the documents/drawings same will be intimated.
13. If applicant complies for clarification sought within 15days, same will be processed and approval will be issued.
14. If the applicant does not comply completely to the clarifications within the stipulated 15days, application will be rejected with the reason for rejection within 30 working days from the date of receipt of clarification and drawing scrutiny fees paid will be forfeited
15. Once the drawings are approved by the authority the same can be viewed /downloaded on-line in My Application Status button available in the Consumer login

13. Grant of Commissioning Approval
Eligibility: Electrical Installation in the jurisdiction of the state of Karnataka(Electrical Installation belonging to Government of India and its undertakings are excluded).
Supporting Document:
1) Form-B1(Electrical Contractor Work Completion and test report), Form-A1( Report of Commencement of work)
2) Manufacturer Test report of Equipments
Note:- Prescribed inspection fees shall be paid
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Will be Intimated in drawing approval letter depending upon the capacity of the installation
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 days-Head Office & 30 days Field Office Days
Procedure for applying:
1.Use the created User ID and password to login into the website.
2. After login, click on Approval of Electrical Installation button then select the option Application for installation approval as per the requirement.
3. Applicants shall upload all the required documents/ test reports by clicking browse and upload option.
4. The Applicant shall remit the requisite fee through Online Payment / Delivery Challan
5. Confirmation message will be displayed after successful submission of application.
6. To view application status click on Application Status link available in the home page.
7. Approving authority will start the process at their end as per the uploaded documents/test reports.
8. After verification of documents by the Approving authority, if it is in order date of inspection will be intimated. If any application is not in order any clarification/shortfall in the documents same will be intimated.
9. If applicant complies for clarification sought within 7 days same will be processed for inspection or application will be rejected with the reason for rejection within 30 working days from the date of receipt of clarification and inspection fees paid will be forfeited
10. Upon inspection, if the installation is found to be in general conformity with CEA(Measures Relating to Safety and Electric Supply) Regulation, 2010, approval will be issued. If not observations will be intimated.
11. If the applicant does not comply completely to the observations made during inspection within the stipulated 15 days, application will be rejected with the reason for rejection within 30 working days from the date of receipt of clarification and inspection fees paid will be forfeited
12. Once the installation approved by the authority the same can be viewed /downloaded on-line in My Application Status button available in the Consumer login

Eligibility: The citizen should have passed 10th standard, BE in electrical and electronics engineering (EEE) or Diploam in Electrical and Electronics
Supporting Document:
https://ksei.gov.in/eisoft/Documents/ElectricalContractorLicense-Fresh.pdf
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Issuance: Rs.3025/- Class I & Rs.2025/- Class II & Rs.1025/- Class III(Indivisual,Company,PartnerShip) & Rs.10025/- SuperGrade(Indivisual,Company,PartnerShip)
Renewal: Rs.3025/- ClassI & Rs.2025/- ClassII & Rs.1025/- ClassIII & Rs.10025/- SuperGrade(Indivisual,Company,PartnerShip) Rs 500 for delayed submission
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 Days
Procedure for applying:
Issue:
1 - Citizen will log in to service of official website www.ksei.gov.in website.
2 - Departmental web page showing citizen preparedness, documents to be scanned, Fees to be paid, service delivery period and service process is shown, and make online payment of Fees
3 - Citizen fill all mandatory or non- mandatory fields, upload all the requsite scanned documents( inclusive of list of testing instruments), and make on line payment of Fees.
4 - After successive submission of application citizen will get an acknowledgment. With a SMS giving get Date, Time and Day to go a particular DEI Office to get verification of original documents scanned and Instruments.
5 - After Verification of documents and instrument by the DEI, if all documents are in order the file forwarded to Head Office
6 - If any application is not in order DEI will hold file and a SMS alert will be sent to applicant to comply immediately
7 - If applicant comply,file will be forwarded to Head Office by the DEI, non complying file treated as pending with applicant
8 - On verification at Head Office the file will be submitted to Board for clearence
9 - On approval of Board the Fresh Electrical Licenses will get printed and sent to citizen
10 - Once the license is granted, application for renewal shall be submitted three clear months before the expiry of the license but not before five clear months. 11 - Application may be accepted two clear months before the date of expiry of the license, provided the applicant remits the penal fee as detailed in Annexure-5.
Renewal:
1 - Citizen will log in to service of official website www.ksei.gov.in website.
2 - Departmental web page showing citizen preparedness, documents to be scanned, Fees to be paid, service delivery period and service process is shown
3 - Citizen fill all mandatory or non- mandatory fields, upload all the requsite scanned documents( inclusive of list of testing instruments), and make on line payment of Fees.
4 - After successive submission of application citizen will get an acknowledgement. With a SMS giving get Date, Time and Day to go a particular DEI Office to get Verification of original documents scanned and Instruments.
5 - After Verification of documents and instrument by the DEI, if all documents are in order the file will be forwarded to Head Office
6 - If any application is not in order DEI will hold file and a SMS alert will be sent to applicant to comply immediately 7 - If applicant comply the file will be forwarded to Head Office by the DEI, non complying file will be treated as pending with applicant
8 - On verification at Head Office the file will be submited to Board for clearence
9 - On approval of Board the Renewed Electrical Licenses will get printed and sent to citizen
10 - Once the license is granted, application for renewal shall be submitted three clear months before the expiry of the license but not before five clear months.
11 - Application may be accepted two clear months before the date of expiry of the license, provided the applicant remits the penal fee as detailed in Annexure-5.

21. Renewal of Electrical Contractor Licenses
Eligibility: The citizen should have passed 10th standard, BE in electrical and electronics engineering (EEE) or Diploam in Electrical and Electronics
Supporting Document:
https://ksei.gov.in/eisoft/Documents/ElectricalContractorLicense-Fresh.pdf
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Renewal: Rs.3025/- ClassI & Rs.2025/- ClassII & Rs.1025/- ClassIII & Rs.10025/- SuperGrade(Indivisual,Company,PartnerShip) Rs 500 for delayed submission
Delivery Time (Days) : 90 Days
Procedure for applying:
1 - Citizen will log in to service of official website www.ksei.gov.in website.
2 - Departmental web page showing citizen preparedness, documents to be scanned, Fees to be paid, service delivery period and service process is shown
3 - Citizen fill all mandatory or non- mandatory fields, upload all the requsite scanned documents( inclusive of list of testing instruments), and make on line payment of Fees.
4 - After successive submission of application citizen will get an acknowledgement. With a SMS giving get Date, Time and Day to go a particular DEI Office to get Verification of original documents scanned and Instruments.
5 - After Verification of documents and instrument by the DEI, if all documents are in order the file will be forwarded to Head Office
6 - If any application is not in order DEI will hold file and a SMS alert will be sent to applicant to comply immediately
7 - If applicant comply the file will be forwarded to Head Office by the DEI, non complying file will be treated as pending with applicant
8 - On verification at Head Office the file will be submited to Board for clearence
9 - On approval of Board the Renewed Electrical Licenses will get printed and sent to citizen
10 - Once the license is granted, application for renewal shall be submitted three clear months before the expiry of the license but not before five clear months.
11 - Application may be accepted two clear months before the date of expiry of the license, provided the applicant remits the penal fee as detailed in Annexure-5.

service_name: Department: Department of Handlooms and Textiles
text:
Department: Department of Handlooms and Textiles

1. To provide 20 Percentage Rebate to societies upto INR 2 Lakhs
Eligibility: Handloom weavers co-operative and Apex co-operative societies.
Supporting Document:
Handloom weavers co-op societies/Apex societies should upload Annexure A (CA certified copy) in Seva Sindhu portal. All other documents can be submitted during field level inspection to the department officers.
1. First and Last sales Bill for sales rebate quarter.
2. Proforma 1 & 2
3. Annexure -B (Mandatory submission in Seva Sindhu portal)
4. Annexure -C
5. Annexure -D & D-1
6. Declaration about the financial assistance received from government in precribed format,
7. Raw materail purchase bills
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.100
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 days
Procedure for applying:
Submit the Application using Seva sindhu portal for sanctioning of the rebate order for each quarter.

2. Issue of sanction letter to Partial withrawal and final settlement of thrift fund to Handloom weavers
Eligibility: Weavers Member of Primary Handloom Weavers Co-operative Societies and Weavers Member of Karnataka Handloom Development Corporation Sub-Centers.
Supporting Document:
1) Reason for withrawal from weaver.
2) Society resolution / KHDC recommondation.
3) Annexure-2 (Mandatory)
4) Weaver wise reconciled statement with treasury challans duly attested by DDO based on HOA
5) Table showing Weavers Amt to be dispursed by the society / KHDC.
Application Fee :
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : NA
Delivery Time (Days) : 30
Procedure for applying:

service_name: Submit the application using prescribed format through seva sindhu portal
text:
Submit the application using prescribed format through seva sindhu portal

3. Subidised Power tariff Scheme
Eligibility: Power loom and pre loom units having power connection from 1 to 20 HP which are involved in Power loom weaving and pre loom weaving activities like twisting/ doubling/ warping including pirn winding production activities.
Supporting Document:
1. Copy of PMT certificate / udyog Aadhaar.
2. Power sanction/ connection letter or order.
3. Documents pertaining to building-rented/ownership/ lease agrement.
4. Copy of the electricity bill and reciept
Application Fee : ಅನ್ವಯಿಸುವುದಿಲ್ಲ
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.100
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 days
Procedure for applying:
1. All eligible Powerloom and pre loom industries having sanctioned and connected load up to 20 hp.
2. The Dy Director/Asst.Director of handlooms and textile dept. will make a list of eligible units after due physical verification.
3. First time the list will be submitted to the jurisdictional electricity supply Companies (ESCOMs) Their after the Dy.Director/Asst/Director of Handlooms & textile Dept. will verify the status of the unit and report to the concern ESCOMS every six months.
4. The respective eleciricity supply companies will charge at the rate of Rs.1-25 per unit as per the scheme guidelines.
5. The eleciricity supply company will levy subsidized tariff to the list of units provided by the Department of Handlooms and Textile.
6. The difference of amount between the present rate of power tariff and the subsidized power tariff will be claimed by the respective eleciricity supply compaines from the Commissinor for the Textile Depvt. and Director of Handlooms and Textile once in six months.

4. Sanction of incentives and concessions on Investment proposals under Textile policy upto 25 lakhs only.(Credit Linked Capital Subsidy(NJN) service)
Eligibility: All the new / expansion / diversification/ modernization textile & garment units in which investments have been made by availing 50% term loans on eligible fixed assets from financial institutions are eligible to claim the subsidy.
Supporting Document:
a) Application in the prescribed form (in duplicate) – (Common Application Form A if registered)
b) Copy of Entrepreneur Memorandum from DIC/ MSME Certificate (Udyog Aadhar).
c) Detailed Project Report
d) Copy of Land and Power related documents viz. (Katha Extract, NA conversion, Power Sanction order, Land Allotment letter, possession letter).
e) Applicant Declaration as per Annexure 1
f) Statement of Fixed Assets in the prescribed format certified by the Unit – (Annexure 2)
g) Investment Certificate issued by the Bank or financial institution – (Annexure 3)
h) Copies of receipts / bills / vouchers etc. in respect of the payments made towards investment.
i) Copy of the loan sanction order of the concerned bank/ financial institution.
j) Government approved/ registered Engineers / Architect’s Certificate in the prescribed format regarding investment made on Construction of Building – (Annexure 5)
k) Investment Certificate in the prescribed format issued by Chartered Accountant – (Annexure 6)
l) Certificate from Bank / FI stating Loan details in the prescribed format – (Annexure 7)
m) Copy of First Sale Invoice
n) Form of declaration regarding employment of local persons– (Annexure9)
o) Copy of registered partnership deed / Memorandum and Articles of Association/ byelaws
p) Copy of Caste certificates in respect of SC/ST/Minority and appropriate certificate/ documents in respect of physically challenged/ Ex-servicemen entrepreneurs duly signed by the Competent Authority
q) Recommendation from District Officers and Division Officers (Annexure 11)
r) Any other document requested by the Department needs to be submitted by the project proponent
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.100
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 Days
Procedure for applying:
The textile unit should file the claim in a time bound manner (with in 9 months from the 1st sale invoice) online with relevant documents in below mentioned website: http://www.karnatakadht.org

service_name: Department: Department of Stamps and Registration
text:
Department: Department of Stamps and Registration

1. Issue of certified copy of Registered documents
Eligibility: Requirement on the basis of publics and requisite fee .
Supporting Document:

service_name: As per the prescreption of the department
text:
As per the prescreption of the department
Application Fee : Single search fee - Rs 25 Copying fee for every 100 words - Rs 5 For Computer registered Docs for every page - Rs 10
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Appl Fee- Rs.10
Each Page - Rs.10
Delivery Time (Days) : 3 days
Procedure for applying:
1) Parties to submit the application in Form 22 to the dealing assistant
2) Dealing Assistant scrutinizes the documents.
3) Parties to pay the applicable fees
4) Office search
5) SR signs the document copy
6) Parties collect Certified Copy of the document

2. Issue of certified copy of the certificate of Registartion of firms under the Indian Partnership Act 1932
Eligibility: Transaction People
Supporting Document:
1 . PARTNERSHIP DEED ALONG ITS COPY
2 . FORM NO. I ALONG WITH DECLARATION DUTY ATTESTED
Application Fee : 1) Statement under section 58 Rs 100.00
2) Statement under section 60 Rs 50.00
3) Statement under section 61 to 64 Rs 25.00
4) Search fee under section 66(1) Rs 20.00 5) Search fee under section 66(2) Rs 10.00
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.1000
Delivery Time (Days) : 3 days
Procedure for applying:
 1) Parties present before District Registrar (DR) along with relevant forms.
2) DR scrutinizes the documents and checks in the system if firm with same name and address is already registered or objectionable words used in the name of firm.
3) Parties shall pay the applicable fees.
4) Generate Acknowledgement.
5) Certificate of FIrm is issued along with signature and seal of DR.
6) Parties to collect Acknowledgement receipt.

Bride -18 Year

3 . JOINT PHOTOGRAPHS OF 2B SIZE
4 . AGE PROOF - both
5 . ADDRESS PROOF - both
6 . WEDDING CARD
Application Fee : 1. For Certified copies a. for every certified copy of marriage memorandum and identity slip, if any Rs.10 b. For every certified copy of application of form VII Rs.10 c. For every certified copy of order of refusal to file memorandum of marriage by Registrar. Rs.10 2. Miscellaneous a. For every application presented to the Registrar. Rs.10 b. For every search of a marriage memorandum. Rs.10 per year
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Certificate Fee each - Rs.10 + Scanning Fee
Delivery Time (Days) : 3 days
Procedure for applying:
1) Parties present before Marriage officer(MO) along with duly filled Application, Memorandum and other relevant documents.
2) Marriage officer will scrutinize the documents.
3) Bride and Bride groom present before Dealing assistant and sign the declaration form.
4) Pay scanning fee and marriage fee as applicable.
5) Marriage officer issues the certificate with Seal and signature.
6) Parties sign on acknowledgement and collect Marriage certificate.

4. Issue of certified copy of the certificate of Registration of Marriage under Special Marriage (Regular forms) Act 1954
Eligibility: Bride Groom -21 Year Bride -18 Year
Supporting Document:
1. Notice of intended Form
2. Photos- both - 4 Nos
3. Age proof both
4. Address proof both
Application Fee : 1. for every notice of intended marriage or application for the registration of a marriage (to be paid by the parties to the Marriage) - Rs 3.00 2. for recording an objection (to be paid by the objector) - Rs 2.00 3. for every enquiry into an objection (to be paid by the objector) - Rs 50.00
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : As per application Rs.3+12 Filing Fee + Scanning Fee
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 Days objection period
Procedure for applying:
1) Parties present before Marriage officer(MO) along with duly filled Application, Memorandum and other relevant documents. 2) Marriage officer will scrutinize the documents. 3) Bride and Bride groom present before Dealing assistant and sign the declaration form. 4) Pay scanning fee and marriage fee as applicable. 5) Marriage officer issues the certificate with Seal and signature. 6) Parties sign on acknowledgement and collect Marriage certificate.

5. Issue of certified copy of the certificate of Registration of Marriage under Special Marriages (Other forms) Act 1954
Eligibility: Bride Groom -21 Year
Bride -21 Year .
Supporting Document:
1 . DECLARATION BY THE BRIDE AND GROOM
2 . MEMORANDUM OF MARRIAGES in other Forms.
3. 2 B Size Joint Photos - 5 Nos
4. Address proofs - both
6. Wedding Card
Application Fee : Rs.3+12
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Scanning Fee
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 Days objection period
Procedure for applying:
1) Special Marriage – Other forms Same Procedure as Special Marriage (Regular) with the following exceptions. 2) Shall be registered if the ceremony of marriage has already been performed between the parties and they have been living together as husband and wife. 3) Taking of Oath and Solemnization of marriage by the MO shall not happen 4) No restrictions on marriage solemnization period of 90 days for registration of Marriage

Eligibility: Requrement of the Public
Supporting Document:
Form No.22 to be filled and submit to office
Application Fee : Application Fee-Rs.10
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Ist Year - Rs.30
Next every year- Rs.10
Delivery Time (Days) : NA

Form No.22 with all particulars and after verify the search application amount to be collected by the party then E.C to be prepaird as per rules.

Department: Directorate of Tourism

1. Homestay Registration
Eligibility: 1.The property where the individual or any of his or her family is intending to operate the Homestay must be owned by the individual who is applying for registration of Homestay
2.The owner of the Homestay or any of his or her family should physically reside in the same Homestay which he or she intends to register and operate
3.If the Homestay owner is operating more than one Homestay, then only one Homestay may be registered in which the owner resides.
4.The Homestay should have an internal road connection which is in good condition for easy access to the tourists visiting the Homestay
5.The proposed Homestay should not be registered as a hotel or a commercial establishment and should not have availed any benefits through policy / act / guidelines of the State or Central Government

service_name: Homestay owner should clearly inform to the guests about the facilities and the exact rates for availing the facilities
text:
Homestay owner should clearly inform to the guests about the facilities and the exact rates for availing the facilities
6.The Homestay unit should ensure that the dwelling is in good condition and clean for guests at all times, and is in accordance with the applicable regulatory measures including quality, health, hygiene, safety and fire safety
7.The name board at the main entrance of the Homestay should contain the logo of the Department of Tourism, Government of Karnataka and also the phrase “Registered with Department of Tourism, Government of Karnataka”. The same must be clearly visible from a considerable distance.
8.The Homestay should display an information board in the lobby containing the tariff details along with the details and phone numbers of the nearest police station (Local Jurisdiction) and hospital The same must be clearly visible from a considerable distance.
9.The details of every guest should be entered in the registration book and the same should also be maintained in digital format
10.The applicable registration fee for Homestay for a duration of 5 years is INR 500 (Indian Rupees Five Hundred only)
Supporting Document:
1.NOC from Local Authorities(Gram Panchayath/Pattana Panchayath/City Corporation/BBMP/Purasabhe etc)
2.NOC from Police Department
3.Ownership Document
4.Residential Certificate
5.Adhar Card
6.PAN Card
7.Homestay Photos (Inside, Outside, Bedroom,Bathroom, living room etc)
8.Owner Photo
Application Fee : Rs.500
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.40
Delivery Time (Days) : 45 days
Procedure for applying:
1.Applicant submits the application form after uploading necessary documents
2.AD/DD Forward/Reject/Seeks Clarification of the application submitted by applicant
3.Applicant will re-submit the requested document as a response to Seek Clarification
4.Assistant Director Approve/Rejects/Seek clarification of the application submitted by AD/DD
5.AD/DD will verify the details recived from DC and sent to applicant in response to seek clarification
6.The DC approves and output cerificate is issued
7.The DC rejects and endorsement/rejection is issued to the applicant with reason of comments

2. Travel Agent / Tour Operator
Eligibility: 1.The turn over in terms of Indian rupees or foreign exchange by the firm from tour related activities only should be a minimum of Rs.7.5 lakhs per year. This must be certified by the firm’s Auditor and latest FY Audited Profit and Loss Statements.
2.The Travel Agent/Tour Operator should have an office under the charge of the owner or a full-time staff, who is adequately trained/experienced in matters regarding transport, accommodation, currency, customs regulations and general information about tourism and travel related services.
3.The minimum office space should be at least 150 sq feet. Besides, the office may be located in neat and clean surroundings and equipped with telephone and computer reservation system etc.
4.The applicant must mandatorily upload a declaration stating that the travel agent on a monthly basis shall mandatorily share/upload the Tourist Arrival details( Foreign& Domestic) in the Karnataka Tourism Website.
5.A registration amount of Rs 500 to be paid, which is not refundable.
Supporting Document:
1.Registration / Incorporation Certificate
2.Registration certificate under Karnataka shops and Establishment act
3.Address Proof
4.List of Directors / Partners / Name of the Proprietor
5.Brochures or Leaflets
6.Copy of GST Registration Certificate
7.Copy of PAN
8.Details of Office Premises
9.Attested photograph of Proprietor / Partners / Authorized Representative of the Entity
10.Power of Attorney / Board Resolution
11.Photograph of the Office Building Exterior
12.Photograph of the Office Building Interior
13.Photograph of building with Board name stating name of the entity
14.Declaration stating that the travel agent on a monthly basis shall mandatorily share/upload the Tourist Arrival details( Foreign& Domestic) in the Karnataka Tourism Website
Application Fee : Rs.500
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.40
Delivery Time (Days) : 45 Working Days
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant submits the application form after uploading necessary documents
2. AD/DD Forward/Reject/Seeks Clarification of the application submitted by applicant
3. Applicant will re-submit the requested document as a response to Seek Clarification
4. Assistant Director Approve/Rejects/Seek clarification of the application submitted by AD/DD
5. AD/DD will verify the details recived from JD and sent to applicant in response to seek clarification
6. The JD approves and output cerificate is issued
7. The JD rejects and endorsement/rejection is issued to the applicant with reason of comments

Department: Empowerment of Differently Abled and Senior Citizen

1. Application for Senior Citizen Card
Eligibility: The applicant must be at least 60 years of age

service_name: The applicant must be a resident of Karnataka
source_file: Empowerment of Differently Abled and Senior Citizen.txt
text:
The applicant must be a resident of Karnataka
Supporting Document:
1) Age proof
2) Address proof
3) Residence Certificate
3) Blood group report(If blood group details are provided)
Application Fee : Rs 0
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs. 20
Delivery Time (Days) : 21
Procedure for applying:
a) Application submission (Online, B1/K1 centres, CSC centres)
b) The application is routed to the Programme Assistant at the respective district
c) Verification by the Programme Assistant. Recommendations of the Programme Assistant are sent to the District Disabled Welfare Officer (DDWO) for review
d) Verification by the DDWO. Approve or reject the application request

2. Registration of NGOs who work for welfare of Persons with Disabilities
Eligibility: NA
Supporting Document:
1. Annual Reports of preceding 2 years describing service activities of the organisation (single pdf).

8. By-Laws of the society/trust.

10. Statement regarding total number of persons employed in the institution along with their respective duties.

1. Applicant fills the form and attaches the mandatory annexures.

5. Battery operated wheelchairs for persons with disabilities.
Eligibility: the persons with disabilitis must and should be disability of 72% and more are eligible for this scheme
Supporting Document:
1. Persons with disabilities are citizens of India and have resided in Karnataka for at least 10 years.

3. UDID
4. The disability percentage should be not less then 75%

Application Fee : the department is not collecting any fee from the applicant.

1. Applicant submits the application form after uploading necessary documents

2. Application for LPG Connection (Bharat Gas; HP Gas; Indane)
Eligibility: 1) Without considering salary, all permanent employees of Government or Government aided Organisation or Government sponsored Government owned organisation/Boards/Corporations/Deemed organizations and all families remitting Income Tax/Service Tax/VAT/Professional Tax.
2) Having 3 Hectare Dry land or equivalent Irrigation land in Rural areas.
3) In urban areas families having self owned pakka house with a dimension of more than 1000 square feet.
3) Families having four wheeler other than those having one self driven commercial vehicle either Tractor, Maxicab, Taxi etc for livelihood purpose.
4) Family Annual Income limit within Rs.120000.
Supporting Document:

Citizen should upload online
1. Aadhar number of each member and
2. Head of family Income certificate
Application Fee : Rs.50
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : No Service Charge
Delivery Time (Days) : The New PHH Ration Card is issued within 40 working days from the date of Government approval
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant submits the form
2. Applicant will get the Acknowledgment
3. Department will process the application
4. Applicant will receive the LPG Connection

3. Application for the post of "President" of the Karnataka State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission
Eligibility: Serving / Retired Judges of Honble High Court
Supporting Document:
1.ID Card / Service Certificate
2.Uploading of Photo
3.Documents about achievement/publication (optional)
4.Documents supporting the additional information, if any (optional)
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Nil
Delivery Time (Days) : NA
Procedure for applying:
1. Fill the Application and upload the necessary documents.
2. Selection will be made by the Selection Committee constituted under Rule 6(1) of the Consumer Protection (Qualification for appointment, method of recruitment, procedure of appointment, term of office, resignation and removal of the President and members of the State Commission and District Commission) Rules, 2020, in consultation with and subject to the concurrence of the Chief Justice of the High Court as per the directions issued by the Hon’ble Supreme Court of India in Special Leave to Appeal (C)No. 25612/2023 vide its Order dtd. 07.03.2024.

INSTRUCTIONS TO THE APPLICANTS
(Applicants shall read the instructions before filling the Application)
1.Before submitting the application through online, the Applicant shall go through the Notification with regard to post, eligibility, term of office, Salary & allowances, mode/criteria of selection etc.,
2.The Applicants before submitting/filling the online Application, shall have the required information/documents beforehand.
3.Registration - The Applicants shall register with Seva-sindhu portal before applying to the post by creating user ID & Password (Aadhaar based).
4.Applicant is allowed to fill the Application either in Kannada or in English.
5.The Applicant is allowed to apply through online only till the last date as notified.
6.Applications through post or by hand directly to the concerned Department / State Consumer Commission / Selection Committee, will not be considered.
7.Applicant shall mention his/her valid e-mail ID and Mobile number in the Application. Further communications, if any, will be sent only through the registered e-mail / Mobile.
HOW TO APPLY TO THE POST ONLINE 1.Once the Applicant click on the link “Apply”, Application form will be displayed on the screen for proceeding further.
2.The Applicant must fill-in all the mandatory and other information including uploading of photo, scanned documents and signature and “click” on “Draft”. Applicant shall verify the details filled and if found correct, then click “Submit”.
3.Once submission of the Application is completed, the applicant shall download the acknowledgment for having submitted the Application.
4.In case Applicant needs clarification or finds any difficulty relating to technical issues while submitting the Application, may contact No.080-22279954 / 8792662814 / 8792662816 during the office hours i.e., between 09.30 AM to 6.30 PM (except on government holidays).

service_name: Department: Forest, Ecology and Environment Department
text:
Department: Forest, Ecology and Environment Department

1. Permission for felling of Sandal wood trees grown on Private lands
Eligibility: Ownership on land and the tree
Supporting Document:
1. Document pertaning to establish Right to land (year of grant or assignment and the period of the continuous occupation by the owner)
2. Document regarding Tenure of the land (hiduvali, Darkhast, lease, Coffee/Cardamom Malai, Bane, and so on and whether redeemed or unredemmed)
3. Revenue records along with the certificate of Deputy Commissioner or the Assistant Commissioner as per Government Circular No. RD 10 LGN 73 dated:4th June 1973.
4. RTC Copy- with Sy.No, Extent etc.,
5. Right to Sandalwood trees to be felled (Proof of right if any as per revenue records).
6. Consent of the other owners having share in the right to land and the trees, if any
Certified copies of the extracts of Revenue Records and the Survey Sketch certified by the Assistant Superintendent of Land Records.
7. Form-13: Form of declaration and indemnity to be furnished by the owner of land of sandalwood trees in the event of Forest Department undertaking extraction and removal on behalf of the owner)
8. The number of sandalwood trees intended to be felled and sold. (a detailed list with their girths at 1.37 metre height from ground level.)
Application Fee : NIL
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.30
Delivery Time (Days) : 45 days
Procedure for applying:
1. Submission of Application to Jurisdictional Range Forest Officer (RFO)
2. Verification of Application by Range Forest Officer and forwarding the same to Range Case worker for verification of documents
3. Verification of documents, writing to revenue department seeking revenue opinion if any required, updating the revnue opinion details and submission of application and remarks to Range Forest Officer
4. Forwarding application by Range Forest Officer to concerned Deputy Range Forest Officer (DRFO)/ Beat Forester for field inspection and report
5. Spot verification, measurement of trees and submission of report by Deputy Range Forest Officer to Range Forest Officer
6. Verification of report submitted by DRFO and/or spot verification by Range Forest Officer and submission of report to the jurisdictional Assistant Conservator of Forests (ACF)
7. Verification of report submitted by RFO and/or spot verification by ACF and submission of report to the jurisdictional Deputy Conservator of Forests (DCF)
8. Forwarding the application by DCF to Division Manager to verify the documents and reports submitted by RFO & ACF
9. Verification of application, field verification reports and recommendations of RFO& ACF and submission of report to DCF 10. According/Rejecting Felling Permission by DCF

Application Fee : 0

Procedure for applying:
The karnataka government is providing the subsidy amount for the people who are travelling to the Kashi yatra , people need to get register and fill in required details and upload the documents, the submitted details will be verified by the respective case worker , HQA and the approved data will be shared to sevasindu for the further payment process.

8. ಮಾನ್ಯತೆ ಪಡೆಯದ ಗ್ರಾಮೀಣ ಪತ್ರಕರ್ತರಿಗೆ ಉಚಿತ ಬಸ್‍ಪಾಸ್
Eligibility: 1. ಮಾನ್ಯತೆ ಪಡೆಯದ ಪತ್ರಕರ್ತರು ಬಸ್ ಪಾಸ್ ಪಡೆಯುಲು ಈ ಕೆಳಕಂಡ ಷರತ್ತುಗಳನ್ನು ಪೂರೈಸಿರಬೇಕು.
2.ಅರ್ಜಿದಾರರು ಪ್ರತಿನಿಧಿಸುವ ಮಾಧ್ಯಮ ಸಂಸ್ಥೆಗಳು ವಾರ್ತಾ ಮತ್ತು ಸಾರ್ವಜನಿಕ ಸಂಪರ್ಕ ಇಲಾಖೆಯ ಮಾಧ್ಯಮ ಪಟ್ಟಿಯಲ್ಲಿ ಇರಬೇಕು.
Supporting Document:
ಪೂರ್ಣಾವಧಿ ಪತ್ರಕರ್ತರಾಗಿ ಸೇವೆ ಸಲ್ಲಿಸುತ್ತಿರುವ ಬಗ್ಗೆ ಪ್ರಸ್ತುತ ಕಾರ್ಯನಿರ್ವಹಿಸುತ್ತಿರುವ ಸಂಸ್ಥೆಯ ನೇಮಕಾತಿ ಆದೇಶ, ಕಳೆದ 6 ತಿಂಗಳ ವೇತನ ರಸೀತಿ/ಬ್ಯಾಂಕ್ ಸ್ಟೇಟ್ ಮೆಂಟ್ , ಕನಿಷ್ಟ ನಾಲ್ಕು (4) ವರ್ಷಗಳ ಸೇವಾನುಭವಕ್ಕೆ ಸಂಬಂಧಪಟ್ಟಂತೆ ಸೂಕ್ತ ದಾಖಲೆಗಳನ್ನು ಒದಗಿಸಬೇಕು.
Application Fee : Nil
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.20
Delivery Time (Days) : NA
Procedure for applying:
1. ಅರ್ಜಿದಾರರು ಅಗತ್ಯ ದಾಖಲೆಗಳೊಂದಿಗೆ ಅರ್ಜಿಯನ್ನು ಸಲ್ಲಿಸುವುದು. ಅರ್ಜಿದಾರರು ತಮ್ಮ ಸಂಸ್ಥೆಯ ಮುಖ್ಯಸ್ಥರ ಶಿಫಾರಸ್ಸಿನೊಂದಿಗೆ ಸ್ವಯಂಘೋಷಣೆಯೊಂದಿಗೆ ಅರ್ಜಿಗಳನ್ನು ಸಲ್ಲಿಸಬೇಕು. (ಶಿಫಾರಸ್ಸು ಪತ್ರ ಹಾಗೂ ಅರ್ಜಿದಾರರ ಸ್ವಯಂ ಘೋಷಣೆ ಪತ್ರವನ್ನು ಪೋರ್ಟಲ್ ನಲ್ಲಿ ಅಳವಡಿಸಲಾಗಿದೆ) ಸಂಬಂಧಪಟ್ಟ ಜಿಲ್ಲೆಯ ಉಪನಿರ್ದೇಶಕರು/ಹಿರಿಯ ಸಹಾಯಕ ನಿರ್ದೇಶಕರು/ಸಹಾಯಕ ನಿರ್ದೇಶಕರು ಸ್ವೀಕೃತವಾಗಿರುವ ಅರ್ಜಿಗಳನ್ನು ಪರಿಶೀಲಿಸಿ ಪೂರಕ ದಾಖಲೆಗಳು ಸರಿ ಇದ್ದಲ್ಲಿ ಅರ್ಜಿಯನ್ನು ಶಿಫಾರಸ್ಸಿನೊಂದಿಗೆ ಕೇಂದ್ರ ಕಚೇರಿಗೆ ಸಲ್ಲಿಸುವುದು ಅಥವಾ ದಾಖಲೆಗಳ ಕುರಿತು ಸ್ಪಷ್ಟೀಕರಣ ಕೋರಿ ಅರ್ಜಿದಾರರಿಗೆ ಹಿಂದಿರುಗಿಸುವುದು.
2.ಉಪನಿರ್ದೇಶಕರು/ ಹಿರಿಯ ಸಹಾಯಕ ನಿರ್ದೇಶಕರು ಸಹಾಯಕ ನಿರ್ದೇಶಕರು ಕೋರಿರುವ ಸ್ಪಷ್ಟೀಕರಣವನ್ನು ಪರಿಷ್ಕರಿಸಿ ಅರ್ಜಿದಾರರು ಅರ್ಜಿಗಳನ್ನು ಪುನರ್ ಸಲ್ಲಿಸುವುದು.
3.ಉಪನಿರ್ದೇಶಕರು/ ಹಿರಿಯ ಸಹಾಯಕ ನಿರ್ದೇಶಕರು ಸಹಾಯಕ ನಿರ್ದೇಶಕರು ಅರ್ಜಿಗಳನ್ನು ಅನುಮೋದಿಸಬಹುದು ಅಥವಾ ತಿರಸ್ಕರಿಸಬಹುದು ಎಂಬ ಷರಾದೊಂದಿಗೆ ಕೇಂದ್ರ ಕಚೇರಿಗೆ ಅನುಮೋದನೆಗಾಗಿ ಸಲ್ಲಿಸುವುದು.
4.ಜಿಲ್ಲಾ ಕಚೇರಿಗಳಿಂದ ಸ್ವೀಕೃತವಾದ ಅರ್ಜಿಗಳ ದಾಖಲೆಗಳೊಂದಿಗೆ ಕೇಂದ್ರ ಕಚೇರಿಯಲ್ಲಿ ಪುನರ್ ಪರಿಶೀಲಿಸಿ ಶಿಫಾರಸ್ಸಿನೊಂದಿಗೆ ಸಮಿತಿಯ ಅನುಮೋದನೆಗೆ ಸಲ್ಲಿಸುವುದು.
5.ಸಮಿತಿಯು ಅರ್ಜಿಗಳನ್ನು ಕೂಲಂಕಷವಾಗಿ ಪರಿಶೀಲಿಸಿ ಅನುಮೋದಿಸಿದೆ ಅಥವಾ ತಿರಸ್ಕರಿಸಿದೆ ಎಂಬ ಷರಾದೊಂದಿಗೆ ತಮ್ಮ ಅಭಿಪ್ರಾಯ ವ್ಯಕ್ತಪಡಿಸುವುದು. ಸಮಿತಿಯು ಅನುಮೋದನೆಗೆ ಶಿಫಾರಸ್ಸು ಮಾಡಿದ ಅರ್ಜಿಗಳನ್ನು ಮಾನ್ಯ ಆಯುಕ್ತರು ಅನುಮೋದಿಸುವುದು
ಸೂಚನೆಗಳು

text:
Department: Kalyana Karnataka Road Transport Corporation

1. Accident relief fund
Eligibility: Legal Heirs of the deceased
Supporting Document:
1. Death Certificate
2. Postmortem Report
3. Affidavit
4. Police FIR
5. Identity Card
6. “G”-Tree (Generation Tree/Family
7. Passport size photo of legal heirs
8. Legal heirs Bank passbook copy
9. Aadhar
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : 30
Delivery Time (Days) : 30
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant logs into Seva Sindhu portal.
2. Applicant provides the user credentials provided by Drugs Control Department to apply for this service
3. Applicant submits the application on Seva Sindhu portal along with necessary supporting documents and makes the payment for the service.
4. Applicant to provide clarification through re-submission of documents if requested by the Department
5. The approving authority approves and applicant collects the digitally signed certificate or the approving authority rejects and applicant collects the endorsement stating reasons for rejection

4. INR 2000 vouchers for widows of freedom fighters
Eligibility: Wifes/ widows of Freedom Fighters

2. Sanction of honorarium award to families, issued by the Karnataka Accountant General
