text:
Department: Karnataka Building And Other Construction Workers Welfare Board

1. Application for Accident Assistance
Eligibility: Refer the Guidelines
Supporting Document:
1. Photocopy of ID card attested by gazetted officer
2. Photocopy of bank passbook Benificiary or Nominee's in case of benificiary's death
3. Death Certificate (in case of death due to accident )
4.Post mortem report
5.Any Photo ID proof of Nominee
6. FIR copy
7. Medical report
8. Employer Certificate
9. Form XXI-A (This document has to to be filled by the employer and uploaded).
10. Application shall be submitted within one year of accident
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs 30
Delivery Time (Days) : 45
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant needs to submit the application.
2. submission of subscription certificate by SLI/LI.
3. Application processing and Verification by Senior/ Labour Inspector.
4. Preparation of inspection report by Labour Inspector
5. Review and Approval by Labour Officer

2. Application for Funeral Assistance
Eligibility: Refer the Guidelines
Supporting Document:
1. Photocopy of ID card attested by gazetted officer
2. Photocopy of bank passbook Benificiary or Nominee's in case of benificiary's death
3. Death Certificate attested by gazetted officer
4. Ration Card
5. Aadhaar Card
6. Employer Certificate
7. Any Photo ID proof of Nominee
8. Application shall be submitted within one year of death
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs 30
Delivery Time (Days) : 30
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant needs to submit the application.
2. submission of subscription certificate by SLI/LI.
3. Application processing and Verification by Senior/ Labour Inspector.
4. Preparation of inspection report by Labour Inspector
5. Review and Approval by Labour Officer

3. Application for Shrama Samartya
Eligibility: Refer the Guidelines
Supporting Document:
1. Photocopy of ID card attested by gazetted officer
2. Proof of Bank Account
3. This training facility can be availed onece during membership of the benificiary
4. The beneficiary shall be within 55 years of age to undergo training
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs. 25
Delivery Time (Days) : Nill
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant needs to submit the application
2. submission of subscription certificate by SLI/LI.
3. Application processing and Verification by Labour Inspector.
4. Review and Approval by Board
5. Issue of taining certificaate by training center

4. Application for medical assistance
Eligibility: Refer the Guidelines
Supporting Document:
1. Proof of Identity/Smart card issued by the Board
2. Employment Certificate
3. Proof of Bank Account
4. Bills of hospital showing Admission and Discharge Dates and all treatment given
5. Any medical documents on hospitalization of beneficiary/dependent in government/private hospital included in schedule1 of the Karnataka government servents(medical attendance) Rules 1963.
6. Form XXII-A
7. Application can be submitted wihtin 6 months of hospitalisation commencement date.
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs 30
Delivery Time (Days) : 30
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant needs to submit the application.
2. submission of subscription certificate by SLI/LI.
3. Application processing and Verification by Senior/ Labour Inspector.
4. Preparation of inspection report by Labour Inspector
5. Review and Approval by Labour Officer

5. Application for Major Ailments Assistance
Eligibility: Refer the Guidelines
Supporting Document:
1. Proof of Identity/Smart card issued by the Board
2. Employment Certificate
3. Proof of Bank Account
4. Bills of hospital showing Admission and Discharge Dates and all treatment given
5. Any medical documents on hospitalization of beneficiary/dependent in government/private hospital included in schedule1 of the Karnataka government servents(medical attendance) Rules 1963 or a hospital recognized under any insurance scheme of the state government.
6. Form XXII-A
7. Application can be submitted wihtin 6 months of hospitalisation commencement date.
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs 35
Delivery Time (Days) : 45
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant needs to submit the application.
2. submission of subscription certificate by SLI/LI.
3. Application processing and Verification by Senior/ Labour Inspector.
4. Preparation of inspection report by Labour Inspector
5. Review and Approval by Labour Officer

6. Application for delivery assistance
Eligibility: Refer the Guidelines
Supporting Document:
1. Affidavit for second child
2. Proof of Bank Account
3. Photo of Child
4. Employment Certificate
5. Proof of Identity/Smart card issued by the Board
6. Discharge Summary
7. Birth Certificate of Child
8. Application can be submitted wihtin 6 months of delivery
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs 30
Delivery Time (Days) : 30
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant needs to submit the application.
2. submission of subscription certificate by SLI/LI.
3. Application processing and Verification by Senior/ Labour Inspector.
4. Preparation of inspection report by Labour Inspector
5. Review and Approval by Labour Officer

7. Application for educational assistance
Eligibility: Refer the Guidelines
Supporting Document:
1. Proof of Identity/Smart card issued by the Board
2. Ration Card
3. Employment Certificate
4. Proof of Bank Account
5. Details of Education for First Child
6. Details of Education for Second Child
7. Photo of First Child
8. Photo of Second Child
9. Marks card and Study Certificate.
10. Application submitted within 6months of the next Academic year
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs 35
Delivery Time (Days) : 45
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant needs to submit the application.
2. submission of subscription certificate by SLI/LI.
3. Application processing and Verification by Senior/ Labour Inspector.
4. Preparation of inspection report by Labour Inspector (if it is necessary)
5. Review and Approval by Labour Officer

8. Application for marriage assistance
Eligibility: Refer the Guidelines
Supporting Document:
1. Application can be submitted after one year of the registration as a beneficiary with the board.
2. Sumission of subcription certificate by SLI/LI.
3. Employment Certificate
4. Bank Account details
5. Marriage Certificate by Registrar of the marriage.
6. Marriage Invitation Card
7. Affidavit if marriage is outside Karnataka state
8. Ration Card

Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs. 25
Delivery Time (Days) : 60
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant needs to submit the application.
2. Preparation of subscription certificate.
3. Application processing and Verification by Senior/ Labour Inspector.
4. Preparation of inspection report by Labour Inspector
5. Review and Approval by Labour Officer

9. Application for Pension
Eligibility: Refer the Guidelines
Supporting Document:
1. Photocopy of ID card attested by gazetted officer
2. Original ID card submitted to the Board
3. Photocopy of benificiary's bank passbook
4. Provide Living Certificate every year
5. Ration Card
6. Employer Certificate
7. Application can be submitted wihtin 6 months after attaining the age of sixty years
8. In case of Beneficiary death, Nominee should provide death certificate to Board
9. Before attaining age of 60 years Registered construction worker shall be the beneficiary of the board continuously for the period of 3 years.
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs. 25
Delivery Time (Days) : NA
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant needs to submit the application.
2. submission of subscription certificate by SLI/LI.
3. Application processing and Verification by Senior/ Labour Inspector.
4. Preparation of inspection report by Senior/Labour Inspector
5. Review and Approval by Secretary /Joint Secretary
6. In case the data of the beneficiary is not available, the data has to be fetched from the labour officer
7. Copy of the Age proof attached submitted at the time of Registration

10. Application for disability pension and ex-gratia
Eligibility: Refer the Guidelines
Supporting Document:
1. Photocopy of ID card attested by gazetted officer
2. Original ID card submitted to the Board
3. Photocopy of benificiary's bank passbook
4.Provide Living Certificate every year
5. Ration Card
6. Employer Certificate

9. Photo copy of the disabled beneficiary
10. Application can be submitted wihtin 6 months from the date of issue of disability ID card by competent authority
11. In case of Beneficiary death, Nominee should provide death certificate to Board
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs. 30
Delivery Time (Days) : NA
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant needs to submit the application .
2. submission of subscription certificate by SLI/LI.
3. Application processing and Verification by Senior/ Labour Inspector.
4. Preparation of inspection report by Senior/Labour Inspector
5. Review and Approval by Secretary /Joint Secretary
6. In case the data of the beneficiary is not available, the data has to be fetched from the labour officer
7. Copy of the Age proof attached submitted at the time of Registration

Supporting Document:

2. Proof of Bank Account
3. Photo of Child
4. Employment Certificate
5. Proof of Identity/Smart card issued by the Board
6. Discharge Summary
7. Birth Certificate of Child
8. Application can be submitted wihtin 6 months of delivery
9. Application can be submitted every year (upto three years)
10. Child living Affidavit shall be submitted for second and third year.
Application Fee : NA

Delivery Time (Days) : NA
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant needs to submit the application .
2. submission of subscription certificate by SLI/LI.
3. Application processing and Verification by Senior/ Labour Inspector.
4. Preparation of inspection report by Senior/Labour Inspector
5. Review and Approval by Labour Officer

Eligibility: Refer the Guidelines
Supporting Document:
1. Living Certificate every year
2. In case of Beneficiary death, Nominee should provide death certificate to Board

16. Application for Registration as Beneficiary with the Karnataka Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board

service_name: Department: Karnataka Council For Technological Upgradation (K.C.T.U.)
text:
Department: Karnataka Council For Technological Upgradation (K.C.T.U.)

1. Incentives for Quality certification - AS 9100 Series Certification
Eligibility: 1. The Existing Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises in Aerospace and Defense sector located in the districts of Karnataka who have acquired the AS9100 are eligible to claim incentives under this scheme.
2. The Unit has to claim the incentives within the validity of the AS9100 series certification (i.e upto 3 Years from the date of issue of certificate).
3. The scheme shall provide one time incentive/assistance only.
Supporting Document:
1. Self attested Copy of Udyam Registration.
2. Self attested Copy of AS9100series Certificate.
3. Statement of expenditure with invoices and receipts in Annexure-2.
4. Chartered Accountant certificate of Plant & Machinery and Turn over in Annexure -3.
5. An affidavit stating that AS9100 incentive has not been availed earlier from any Government Agency Annexure - 4.
6. Self- attested copy of Quality Manual.
7. Self attested copy of partnership deed/ certificate of incorporation / By-laws (If Applicable).
8. Self attested copy of Minority/ SC / ST/PH/Ex Service (If Applicable).
Application Fee : No Application fee
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.100
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 working days
Procedure for applying:
1. MSME units to submit the duly filled application in the prescribed format along with the documents mentioned to respective Joint Director DIC.
2. The Joint Director, DIC on receipt of duly filled application with complete documents mentioned shall inspect the MSME units and verify the working condition and submit the application to KCTU for sanction of financial assistance.
3. The Managing Director, KCTU shall verify the proposal and place the valid proposals before the State Level Sanction Committee (SLSC) for consideration

2. Incentives for Quality certification - NADCAP Series Certification
Eligibility: 1. The Existing Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises in Aerospace and Defense sector located in the districts of Karnataka who have acquired the NADCAP Certification are eligible to claim incentives under this scheme.
2. The Unit has to claim the incentives within the validity of the NADCAP Certification (i.e upto 3 Years from the date of issue of certificate).
3. The scheme shall provide one time incentive/assistance only.
Supporting Document:
1. Self attested Copy of Udyam Registration.
2. Self attested Copy of NADCAP series Certificate.
3. Statement of expenditure with invoices and receipts in Annexure-2.
4. Chartered Accountant certificate of Plant & Machinery and Turn over in Annexure -3.
5. An affidavit stating that this incentive has not been availed earlier from any Government Agency Annexure - 4.
6. Self- attested copy of Quality Manual.
7. Self attested copy of partnership deed/ certificate of incorporation / By-laws (If Applicable).
8. Self attested copy of Minority/ SC / ST/PH/Ex Service (If Applicable).
Application Fee : NIL
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.100
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 working days
Procedure for applying:
1. MSME units to submit the duly filled application in the prescribed format along with the documents mentioned to respective Joint Director DIC.
2. The Joint Director, DIC on receipt of duly filled application with complete documents mentioned shall inspect the MSME units and verify the working condition and submit the application to KCTU for sanction of financial assistance.
3. The Managing Director, KCTU shall verify the proposal and place the valid proposals before the State Level Sanction Committee (SLSC) for consideration

3. Incentives for Quality certification-- ISO Series Certification
Eligibility: 1. Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises operating in districts of state who have acquired the ISO series certifications from NABCB accredited agencies are eligible to claim incentive under this scheme.
2. The Unit has to claim the incentive within the validity of the ISO series certification (i.e upto 3 Years from the date of issue of certificate).
3. In case the unit has obtained different types of ISO certification, the benefit of this incentive will be to only one type of ISO certification which is financially beneficial to the unit.
4. The scheme shall provide one time incentive / assistance only.
Supporting Document:
1.Self-attested copy of Udyam Registration.
2. Statement of expenditure with invoices and receipts In Annexure-20
3. Self- attested copy of the ISO Certificate obtained from NABCB accredited agencies.
4. Self- attested copy of Quality Manual .
5. Self attested copy of partnership deed/ certificate of incorporation / By-laws (If Applicable).
6. Self attested copy of Minority/ SC / ST/PH/Ex Service (If Applicable).
Application Fee : No Application fee
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.100
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 working days
Procedure for applying:
1.MSME units to submit the duly filled application in the prescribed format along with the documents mentioned to respective Joint Director DIC.
2. The Joint Director, DIC on receipt of duly filled application with complete documents mentioned shall inspect the MSME units and verify the working condition and submit the application to KCTU for sanction of financial assistance.
3. The Managing Director, KCTU shall verify the proposal and place the valid proposals before the State Level Sanction Committee (SLSC) for consideration

4. Incentives for Quality certification- BIS Certification
Eligibility: 1. The Existing Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises who have acquired the BIS product certifications are eligible to claim incentives under this scheme.
2. The Unit has to claim the incentives within the validity of the BIS certification (i.e within 1 Year from the date of issue of certificate).
3. The scheme shall provide one time incentive/assistance only.
Supporting Document:
1.Self-attested copy of Udyam Registration.
2. The copy of the BIS Certificate.
3. Statement of expenditure with invoices and receipts In Annexure-20.
4. Self attested copy of partnership deed/ certificate of incorporation / By-laws (If Applicable).
5. Self attested copy of Minority/ SC / ST/PH/Ex Service (If Applicable).
Application Fee : No Application fee
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.100
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 working days
Procedure for applying:
1.MSME units to submit the duly filled application in the prescribed format along with the documents mentioned to respective Joint Director DIC.
2. The Joint Director, DIC on receipt of duly filled application with complete documents mentioned shall inspect the MSME units and verify the working condition and submit the application to KCTU for sanction of financial assistance.
3. The Managing Director, KCTU shall verify the proposal and place the valid proposals before the State Level Sanction
3. The Managing Director, KCTU shall verify the proposal and place the valid proposals before the State Level Sanction Committee (SLSC) for consideration

5. Incentives for Quality certification- WE -CONNECT Certification
Eligibility: 1. The Existing Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises who have acquired the We-connect certification from We-connect international are eligible to claim incentives under this scheme.
2. The Unit has to claim the incentives within the validity of the We-connect certification.
3.The scheme shall provide incentive / subsidy only for the first three years.
Supporting Document:
1.Self-attested copy of Udyam Registration.
2. The copy of the WE-CONNECT Certificate.
3. Statement of expenditure with invoices and receipts In Annexure-20.
4. Self attested copy of partnership deed/ certificate of incorporation / By-laws (If Applicable).
5. Self attested copy of Minority/ SC / ST/PH/Ex Service (If Applicable).
Application Fee : No Application fee

Department: Karnataka Public Service Commission

1. Application for Departmental Examination conducted by KPSC
Eligibility: Criteria based on subjects opted by the candidate as per Department Notification:http://www.kpsc.kar.nic.in/DE2020F.PDF
Supporting Document:
1.Recommendation letter from the Head of Office for taking scribe in the Departmental
2.ExaminationCertificate of disability as per G.O.DPAR 115 SENENI 2005 dt. 19-11-2005 format
3.No Objection Certificate obtained from Head of Office/Appointed authority
4.Cadre & Recruitment copy
5.Form-D
6.Accounts Higher Certificate
7.Marks card indicating the subject studied claimed for Degree based exemptions
8.Degree Certificate
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : NA
Delivery Time (Days) : NA
Procedure for applying:
1.Candidates shall access Seva Sindhu portal through Seva Sindhu Website (https://sevasindhu.karnataka.gov.in)
2.If the candidate has an existing account in Seva Sindhu, he/she shall login with his/her username & password or Mobile number & OTP on the portal
3.If the candidate does not have an account in Seva Sindhu, he/she mustclick on “New User? Register here” after which Digilocker page will open.
4.Candidates shall access Seva Sindhu portal through Seva Sindhu Website (https://sevasindhu.karnataka.gov.in).
5.Candidate shall create his/her Seva Sindhu account by entering valid Email Address and Mobile number. By creating Password and entering the OTP received on Email and Mobile Number, candidate shall successfully register in Seva Sindhu.
6.After logging in, candidate shall click on the Link “Apply for KPSC Departmental Exam” on the Home page.
7. Candidate shall read all the necessary instruction and fill the application form. After pressing “Submit” a preview of the application form filled is available
8.The candidate shall attach necessary documents by clicking on “Attach Annexure”.
9.Once documents are uploaded, candidate shall click on “Save Annexures”. A preview of the application form along with annexures is available.
10.Candidate then shall click on “eSign and Make Payment” and click on “I agree with above user consent and eSign terms and conditions”.
11.Candidate shall enter Aadhar Number and it shall be validated using OTP.
12.Candidate shall make online paymentby clicking on “Make Payment”
13.An acknowledgment Form is generated once application is submitted. The Application No. shall be used for futurecorrespondence.
14.In case of any clarifications, candidates can call 080-4455 4455.

Eligibility: Student
Supporting Document:
1. Diploma Certificate
2. All three years GNM markscard
3. Applicant photo
Application Fee : 500
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : 20
Delivery Time (Days) : 10
Procedure for applying:
1.Application form submission by student
2.Verification by case worker
3.Verification by case worker(migration)
4.Application form approval/rejection by Member Secretary

2. Application for verification of genuineness of markscard/degree certificate
Eligibility: Student
Supporting Document:
1.Marks Card
2.Internship Markscard
3.GNM Certificate
4.Course Completion Certificate
Application Fee : within india-500 outside-2000
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : 25
Delivery Time (Days) : 10
Procedure for applying:
1.Application form submission by student
2.Verification by case worker
3.Verification by case worker(migration)
4.Application form approval/rejection by Member Secretary

3. Name and Spelling Correction in the Marks cards & Certificates
Eligibility: Students can apply
Supporting Document:
Original Copies of GNM Marks cards and Certificates along with SSLC Xerox Marks Card.
Application Fee : Rs.500 per Marks Card and Per Diploma Certificate
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.20
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 Days
Procedure for applying:
students can apply and submit the old original documents to board

4. second copy of Marks Cards and Certificates
Eligibility: Students can apply
Supporting Document:
FIR Copy and Affidavit copy along with required Xerox Copies of GNM Marks Cards and Certificates.
Application Fee : Rs.500 per Marks Card and Per Diploma Certificate
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : Rs.20
Delivery Time (Days) : 30 Days
Procedure for applying:
students can apply and should submit the original police complaint and affidavit documents to board

Department: Karnataka State Fire and Emergency Services

1. Application for Clearance Certificate (High rise Building)
Eligibility: Bulding Height above 15m
Supporting Document:
Covering Letter, site plan, ground floor plan, typical floor, elevation, section, fire schematic, built up area statement, ownership document.
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : NA
Delivery Time (Days) : 45 Working Days
Procedure for applying:
NA

2. Application for No Objection Certificate (High rise Building)
Eligibility: Bulding Height above 15m
Supporting Document:
Covering Letter, site plan, ground floor plan, typical floor, elevation, section, fire schematic, built up area statement, ownership document.
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : A fee for Residential Buildings is Rs.35/- per sq.mtr or Rs.2,50,000/- which ever is high and for Non – Residential & Other Type of Buildings Rs.60/- per sq.mtr or Rs.5,00,000/- which ever is high will be charged against the total built up area as per Government Order No. ಒಇ 11 ಕಅಸೇ 2019 Date:13-09-2019..
Delivery Time (Days) : 60 Working Days
Procedure for applying:
NA

Department: Karnataka State Law University

1. Application for issue of Eligibility Certificate
Eligibility: The student who has studied from the concerned university, submits requisite documents, pays requisite fees and gets approval from concerned authority.
Supporting Document:
1.10th Marks card.
2.12th Std/equivalent certificate marks card
3.Bachelors’ Degree all Marks Cards, PDC, Degree Certificate
4.Transfer certificate
5.Migration certificate
6.Caste Certificate (Applicable to student who seek the support from Govt.)
7.Study Permission Letter (Applicable to student who was / is a Professional Employee of an Institution/Company)
Application Fee : Board/UniversityKA 500/-, Non KA 3500/-, Foreign(3Years/5 Years LLB/LLM -Rs.16000, P.G Diploma/Certificate course - Rs.12000)
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : 25
Delivery Time (Days) : 10
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant needs to submit the application.
2. Verification by Case Worker.
3. Verification by Assistant Registrar.
4. Verification by Deputy Registrar.
5. E-sign by Registrar & certificate delivery to applicant.
6. Vice Chancellor receives information on student application status as part of reports.

Supporting Document:
1.KARNATAKA STATE NURSING COUNCIL REGISTRATION CERTIFICATE
2.KARNATAKA STATE NURSING COUNCIL PAYMENT RECEIPT
Application Fee : 500
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) :
Delivery Time (Days) : 17
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant logs into Seva Sindhu portal.
2. Applicant provides the user credentials provided by Drugs Control Department to apply for this service
3. Applicant submits the application on Seva Sindhu portal along with necessary supporting documents and makes the payment for the service.
4. Applicant to provide clarification through re-submission of documents if requested by the Department
5. The approving authority approves and applicant collects the digitally signed certificate or the approving authority rejects and applicant collects the endorsement stating reasons for rejection

service_name: Department: Karnataka State Pollution Control Board (KSPCB)
text:
Department: Karnataka State Pollution Control Board (KSPCB)

1. Consent for Establishment/Consent for Expansion Applications- for Red Category EIA Projects
Eligibility: Project Proponent
Supporting Document:
1.KIADB ALLOTMENT LETTER/LAND CONVERSION ORDER FROM THE COMPETENT AUTHORITY AND LAND RECORDS (SALE DEED, GPA AND JOINT DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENT).
2.COST OF FIXED ASSETS (LAND, BUILDING, PLANT AND MACHINERY) LEASE COPY IN CASE THEY ARE ON LEASE BASIS.
3.PROJECT REPORT CONTAINING MATERIAL BALANCE, WATER BALANCE, MANUFACTURING PROCESS, EXPECTED GENERATION OF DIFFERENT TYPES OF WASTE, THEIR QUANTITY AND WASTE MANAGEMENT DETAILS ALONG WITH PROPOSAL FOR CONTROL OF WATER, AIR POLLUTION AND PROJECT COST.
4.SITE LOCATION MAP
5.LAYOUT PLAN
6.NO OBJECTION CERTIFICATE FROM THE COMPETENT AUTHORITY REGARDING SUPPLY OF WATER (MEGA PROJECTS, LAYOUTS AND APARTMENT PROJECTS).
7.AFFIDAVIT
8.APPROVED SITE PLAN
9.NO OBJECTION CERTIFICATE FROM THE COMPETENT AUTHORITY IN CASE IT IS PROPOSE TO DISPOSE THE EFFLUENT TO UNDER-GROUND DRAINAGE SYSTEM.
10.KIADB ALLOTMENT LETTER/LAND CONVERSION ORDER FROM THE COMPETENT AUTHORITY AND LAND RECORDS (SALE DEED, GPA AND JOINT DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENT)
Application Fee : The applicant shall generate their logins from the Boards website. In their logins, the applicant shall enter the profile details, Water, Air, solid wastes details in XGN software and upload the attested and scanned documents. After scrutiny of documents and other details by Regional officer, the applicant will esign the application form. The Regional Officer will verify whether the online application has been esigned in XGN software. On online verification, the applicant will be able to make online payment of Consent fee through Netbanking or Credit card or Debit card. Subsequently, the Regional officer will inspect the organisation and write the Inspection report in XGN software. The application will be processed through online and in the login of the delegated officer, esigned and eoutwarded CFE and CFExp orders will be issued. esigned and eoutwarded CFE and CFExp orders are made available in the logins of the applicants as well as in the Boards website.
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : NA
Delivery Time (Days) : 120 Working Days
Procedure for applying:
The applicant shall generate their logins from the Boards website. In their logins, the applicant shall enter the profile details, Water, Air, solid wastes details in XGN software and upload the attested and scanned documents. After scrutiny of documents and other details by Regional officer, the applicant will esign the application form. The Regional Officer will verify whether the online application has been esigned in XGN software. On online verification, the applicant will be able to make online payment of Consent fee through Netbanking or Credit card or Debit card. Subsequently, the Regional officer will inspect the organisation and write the Inspection report in XGN software. The application will be processed through online and in the login of the delegated officer, esigned and eoutwarded CFE and CFExp orders will be issued. esigned and eoutwarded CFE and CFExp orders are made available in the logins of the applicants as well as in the Boards website.

In their logins, the applicant shall enter the profile details, Water, Air, solid wastes details in XGN software and upload the attested and scanned documents. After scrutiny of documents and other details by Regional officer, the applicant will esign the application form. The Regional Officer will verify whether the online application has been esigned in XGN software. On online verification, the applicant will be able to make online payment of Consent fee through Netbanking or Credit card or Debit card. Subsequently, the Regional officer will inspect the organisation and write the Inspection report in XGN software. The application will be processed through online and in the login of the delegated officer, esigned and eoutwarded CFE and CFExp orders will be issued. esigned and eoutwarded CFE and CFExp orders are made available in the logins of the applicants as well as in the Boards website.

service_name: Department: Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation
text:
Department: Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation

1. Accident Relief Fund
Eligibility: Legal Heirs of the deceased
Supporting Document:
1. Death Certificate
2. Postmortem Report
3. Affidavit
4. Police FIR
5. Identity Card
6. “G”-Tree (Generation Tree/Family
7. Passport size photo of legal heirs
8. Legal heirs Bank passbook copy
9. Aadhar
Application Fee : NA
Service Charge (Free for Online Submission) : 30
Delivery Time (Days) : 30
Procedure for applying:
1. Applicant logs into Seva Sindhu portal.
2. Applicant provides the user credentials provided by Drugs Control Department to apply for this service
3. Applicant submits the application on Seva Sindhu portal along with necessary supporting documents and makes the payment for the service.
4. Applicant to provide clarification through re-submission of documents if requested by the Department
5. The approving authority approves and applicant collects the digitally signed certificate or the approving authority rejects and applicant collects the endorsement stating reasons for rejection

text:
Department: Karnataka State Womens Development Corporation

1. Udyogini Scheme
Eligibility: 1.Must be a permanent resident of Karnataka. 2.Women in the age of 18 to 55 are eligible.
3.Scheduled Caste & Scheduled Tribe applicants annual family income should not exceed Rs.2.0 lakhs.
4.General/Other category applicants annual family income should not exceed Rs.1.50 lakhs.
Supporting Document:
1. Residential certificate/Ration card/Voter Id
3. Project Report
4. Caste Certificate
5. Income Certificate

7. Application for Special Incentive for Minority Students Pursuing B.Ed
Eligibility: 1. Candidates should belong to Karnataka state.
2. The grant will be awarded every year (maximum 2 years) as per the duration of the said courses.
3. Maximum annual income of parents of minority candidates is Rs. 6.00 lakhs should not be exceeded.
4. Candidates shall be selected on the basis of merit of marks obtained in qualifying examination/previous line examination.
5. Eligible candidates should be selected limited to the grants available in the respective year.
6. Students receiving this scholarship are eligible for Government of India or other scholarships/scholarships.
7. Students availing this facility are eligible for regular admission in Government/Departmental Hostels.
8. Students should submit all official documentation regarding enrollment and fee payment in D.Ed and B.Ed courses.
9. Only students enrolled in government/semi-government/aided and private colleges in B.Ed courses recognized by the National Council for Teacher Education and D.Ed courses recognized by the Department of State Educational Research and Training are eligible.
10. Candidates applying under the said program must have secured minimum 50% marks in qualifying examination/previous line examination. Unsuccessful candidates will not be eligible for incentives.
11. Candidates who have received the incentive in the first year should apply separately for getting the incentive in the second year.
12. At least 50% of the grant released for each district should be reserved for girls and 25% for D.Ed course and 75% for B.Ed course candidates.
13. If incentives are received by giving false information, registration/caste and income certificate, the amount of incentives given to such candidates shall be recovered and returned to the Government.
14. Students who have received incentives under this scheme and who have left the D.Ed and B.Ed course in the middle should be inquired by the district level officials and submit a request to the head of the department. In such cases, the Head of the Department shall take a final decision and if there is no reasonable cause, the amount awarded to the concerned candidates shall be recovered and returned to the Government.
15. The District Minority Officers of the concerned district shall be empowered to sanction and disburse financial assistance under this scheme. The original record of eligible students, details of colleges and other information should be kept in the district office and maintained in a separate register. The relevant documents shall be submitted for inspection as per the demand of the State level authorities/audit audit team.
Supporting Document:
1.ID card issued by college
2.Previous Class Marks Card/ಹಿಂದಿನ ಕ್ಲಾಸ್‌ ಮಾರ್ಕ್ಸ್ ಕಾರ್ಡ್
3.Aadhar card/ಆಧಾರದ ಕಾರ್ಡ್
4.PUC Marks Card/ಪಿಯುಸಿ ಅಂಕಪಟ್ಟಿ
5.Fee Paid Receipt to the Course/ಕೋರ್ಸ್‌ ಪ್ರವೇಶ ಪಡೆದಿರುವ ಕುರಿತು ಶುಲ್ಕ ಪಾವತಿ ರಶೀದಿಗಳು

7.Current Caste and Income Certificate (Maximum Income Limit Rs.06 Lakhs)/ಚಾಲ್ತಿಯಿರುವ ಆದಾಯ ಮತ್ತು ಜಾತಿ ಪ್ರಮಾಣ ಪತ್ರ (ಆದಾಯದ ಗರಿಷ್ಠ ಮಿತಿ ರೂ.06 ಲಕ್ಷಗಳು)

12. Pre-Examination Training for Police Sub-Inspector
Eligibility: 1.Candidates from all districts can apply for the Police Sub Inspector (PSI) recruitment pre-examination training. The candidate applying must be a permanent resident of Karnataka and belong to the minority communities of the state, namely Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Jain, Buddhist and Parsi communities.
2.The candidate must have declared the final year degree result by the last date of application for training.
3.Caste and Income Certificate in the prescribed format must be obtained by the last date of application.
4.The annual income of the candidates family should not exceed Rs. 8.00 lakhs.
5.The minimum age limit for applying for training is 21 years and maximum 30 years.
6.Reservation under the said scheme has been fixed at 82.25% for Muslims, 11.92% for Christians, 4.60% for Jains, 0.24% for Sikhs, 0.98% for Buddhists and 0.01% for Parsis.
If no eligible candidates are available for the specified post,candidates available in other minority categories will be allowed for selection as per percentage reservation.
7.Candidates from the minority community of the state who wish to join the said training will be selected on the basis of merit of marks obtained in the degree.
8.Candidates height: Minimum 168 cm. for males and minimum 157 cm for females. Weight: Minimum 50 kg. for males and minimum 45 kg.for females and Chest circumference (for males):76 cm.
9.Male and female candidates selected for the Police Sub Inspector (PSI) recruitment pre-examination training will be provided with training through a reputable institute in Belgaum & Mysore in the state for a period of 90 days along with food and accommodation.
10.The above guidelines are subject to the orders issued by the Government from time to time and the Department of Minority Welfare has full authority to modify the said guidelines.

13. Hotel Management Training Course
Eligibility: 1.The student applying for Hotel Management Vocational Training should be a permanent resident of Karnataka and should belong to the minority communities of the state such as Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Jain, Buddhist and Parsi communities.
2The student must have passed at least 10th standard.
3.The annual income of the students family should not exceed Rs. 8.00 lakhs.
4.The minimum age limit for applying for training is 18 years and the maximum age limit is 35 years.
5. Reservation under the said scheme is fixed at 82.25% for Muslims, 11.92% for Christians, 4.60% for Jains, 0.24% for Sikhs, 0.98% for Buddhists and 0.01% for Parsis.If no eligible students are available for the specified seat, students from other minority categories will be given the opportunity to be selected based on percentage reservation.
6.The student will be selected on the basis of merit of the marks obtained in 10th class.
7.The students selected for Hotel Management Vocational Training will be provided training along with food and accommodation at the Institute of Hotel Management, Bangalore.
